definition: (arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
one leg over the other (legs crossed)
to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)
to stick one leg over the other (when sitting)

sentences.english: I couldn' t even cross my legs without bumping the hat, and that prospect frightened me.
sentences.chinese: 如果我跷起二郎腿，就一定会碰到帽子。

sentences.english: There is a dog of his head there is a lot like Erlang's eye in the sky.
sentences.chinese: 小狗有一个他的头上有一个很像二郎神的天眼。

sentences.english: He sighs, and wipes stray bread crumbs from his beard, rising to his cloven feet.
sentences.chinese: 他叹了口气，抹掉沾在胡子上的面包屑，翘起二郎腿。

sentences.english: Second, Rocker his legs or hands crossed on his chest.
sentences.chinese: 二是跷二郎腿或两手交叉于胸前。

sentences.english: Quadtree manipulation in Erlang - Will editing a quadtree record invalidate the parent?
sentences.chinese: 四叉树操作二郎将编辑一个四叉树记录无效的父母吗？

sentences.english: Erlangmiao fracture belt is the only fracture structure to connect Houba oil sands.
sentences.chinese: 二郎庙断裂带是邻接厚坝油砂岩的唯一断裂构造。

sentences.english: Rest your elbows on the arm of the chair and maybe cross your legs.
sentences.chinese: 把你的手肘放在椅把上，还可以跨个二郎腿哦。

sentences.english: Erh-lang turned into a huge sea crane and pursued the crow.
sentences.chinese: 二郎神急抖翎毛，摇身变作大海鹤，钻上云霄来啄。

sentences.english: Thousand Years was very much influenced by a Japanese director called [Yasujiro] Ozu.
sentences.chinese: 《千年善祷》很受日本导演小津安二郎的影响。

sentences.english: Moving a stool and sitting at a table, he enjoyed himself tasting the tea slowly, crossing his legs.
sentences.chinese: 就搬了个凳子坐在桌边跷着二郎腿慢慢品咂起来。

sentences.english: Jenny sat down, crossed her legs, and drew her skirt down over her knees.
sentences.chinese: 珍妮坐下来，跷起二郎腿，把裙子向膝盖下拉了一拉。

sentences.english: So there’s no reason to sit on the sidelines tapping your foot.
sentences.chinese: 你没理由翘着二郎腿坐着观望。

definition: (dialect) form of address for one's wife/polite form of address for a woman
(arch.) minister/official/noun prefix denoting function or status/a youth
my husband and master (archaic)/playboy of rich family/pimp
elder brother/term of respect for a man of about the same age
father's elder brother/senior/paternal elder uncle/eldest of brothers/respectful form of address/Count, third of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]
